conclusion: Analyze the motion of the particle in both the electric and magnetic fields.
Particle is launched horizontally with velocity v_0 and enters the magnetic field at point P.
Electric field E is directed vertically downward, and the particle has charge q and mass m.
Electric force acting on the particle is F_e = qE.
Vertical acceleration a is a = qE/m.
Time t to travel horizontally from launch point to point P is t = l/v_0.
Vertical displacement y of the particle is y = qE l^2/(2 m v_0^2).
Horizontal component of velocity at point P remains v_0.
Vertical component of velocity at point P is v_y = qE l/(m v_0).
Angle θ between velocity vector and horizontal is 60 degrees.
Distance d from launch point to point P is d = sqrt(l^2 + y^2).
Substitute y to get d = sqrt(l^2 + (qE l^2/(2 m v_0^2))^2).
Using qE l = m v_0^2 sqrt(3), d = sqrt(l^2 + (sqrt(3) l/2)^2).
Simplify to get d = sqrt((4 l^2 + 3 l^2)/4).
The distance from the particle's launch position to point P is l sqrt(7)/2.
